question.q: When there are many categories, it is best to use a
question.feedback: Pie charts are not good for displaying many categories. Horizontal bar charts are usually better than vertical bar charts because there is more room to label the categories.

question.q: When you have relatively few observations you should use percentages rather than frequencies.
question.feedback: Percentages can be misleading when you have relatively few observations. They can make a small difference look large.

question.q: Three-dimensional bar charts make it easier to interpret the data.
question.feedback: In general, it is a bad idea to have more display dimensions than data dimensions. Three-dimensional bar charts are not as clear as two-dimensional bar charts.
